column1: The results from 2 different COVID-19 vaccine clinical trials are showing overwhelmingly positive results. This is a great first step to building confidence with the public. Read more >> https://t.co/aZ0GM8xdFR https://t.co/7FiNMILeey

Colorado just like nearly every state across the nation is experiencing a surge of COVID-19 cases. Work from home if you are able. Go out in public as sparingly as possible wear your mask and practice social distancing. Read more >> https://t.co/eCGyUvL3PF https://t.co/X8nW1jh6YE
During a rare weekend session the Republican-controlled Senate just advanced RBG's replacement rather than COVID-19 relief talks or voting on HEROES Act. This is appalling » https://t.co/f44Qiy0ht1

As we make developments for a #COVID19 vaccine I'm talking with public health experts & scientists to ensure sure we're taking the steps to meet the requirements & safety precautions before distribution -- the American people deserve nothing less » https://t.co/UDKx2jjtWo https://t.co/U0qh8bJVUB
Organized labor is the backbone of our workforce and has held the country together during the COVID-19 pandemic. I'll always stick by our union leaders and wish everyone a Happy Labor Day!

Victims of Hurricane Laura are not only facing catastrophic effects of the natural disaster and climate change but of COVID-19 as well.   A comprehensive list of how to aid victims of Hurricane Laura in Louisiana and Texas can be found here >> https://t.co/llzLSUKqcW

The public deserves to know how COVID-19 vaccines are progressing. That's why I led a hearing to learn from companies about their efforts. I was glad to hear the process is going well and the vaccine makers pledged not to sacrifice safety for speed.   https://t.co/hXTcy8VwR1 https://t.co/ScTiAi82xp

I was proud to introduce bipartisan legislation last month to support the research community during COVID-19. We need to preserve our scientific infrastructure and protect our innovation pipeline to help us better respond to future pandemics. https://t.co/8jFcf82K59 https://t.co/k8cOagXcRb

Great progress is being made towards developing a vaccine for COVID-19 but we need to prepare now to ensure the American people can access and afford it once it becomes available. That’s why I’ve called for a nationwide vaccine program. https://t.co/6XZdVgNRVi https://t.co/QGlmNMjwnO

My daughter lives with Type 1 diabetes so lowering the skyrocketing cost of insulin is personal. And as Co-Chair of the Congressional Caucus on Diabetes I'm paying close attention to the new challenges Americans with diabetes are facing during COVID-19 https://t.co/F10mGx0rxP https://t.co/hs6jqQGhWU

This pandemic is far from over -- yet the president and his administration continue to downplay the severity of this crisis.  TELL TRUMP: Stop ignoring scientists and public health officials and treat COVID-19 like the dangerous pandemic it is >> https://t.co/xtF0WbojaH https://t.co/5pHOHFuJEN

As Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee Chair I'm working to hold online platforms like Facebook and Twitter accountable >> https://t.co/6ZRpm3qwZ6  It's critical they address the rise of COVID-19 misinformation online that is both troubling and dangerous to public health. https://t.co/0pgymu8viH

Trump Moves to End Federal Support for Testing Sites as US Sees Record Daily Spike in Covid-19 Infections >> https://t.co/LkTf3vpozo  This includes Colorado. We need an expansion of testing not a downright dangerous reduction. https://t.co/3B8uIcP4N4

Ignoring the impact of COVID-19 will not make it go away. We must continue addressing the urgent needs this crisis has created -- including support for our local museums and heritage tourism.  READ MORE >> https://t.co/ydMmKD4gvu

Our fight for racial justice cannot end with policing reform. Black Americans are dying from COVID-19 at nearly two times the rate of their population share nationwide.  These disproportionate public health outcomes must be addressed. Learn more now >> https://t.co/WwxNcHdcM6 https://t.co/C5qegtgQeD

DeGette announces COVID-19 oversight agenda >> https://t.co/7XIT0y0Thp  The administration’s response has been inconsistent and inadequate. Oversight is one of Congress' essential duties and a life-saving step to ensure public health is prioritized moving forward. https://t.co/urZmec0hcb
I got to chat with the @DenverNorthStar about COVID-19 health care the environment and more.   Check it out now: https://t.co/Z4cvk2zVSa https://t.co/y3xl4HvSDm

House Democrats pass $3 trillion coronavirus relief bill despite Trump’s veto threat >> https://t.co/xn3PzhHkvw  The HEROES Act is exactly the kind of smart comprehensive policy we need right now. https://t.co/jPdzWzu0FD

Democrats’ HEROES Act National Coronavirus Relief Bill Carries A Lot Of Colorado Ideas >> https://t.co/FvA1f9TudK  Our priority is clear: YOU. This bold new bill will do many things including my recommendation to study the short and long-term health impacts of this virus. https://t.co/SiDmeVP3yz

Trump vows complete end of Obamacare law despite pandemic >> https://t.co/VMhDf7VzSR  Absolutely unconscionable. The coronavirus has killed over 70000 Americans so far yet Trump is doubling down on his efforts to take away health care from working families. https://t.co/naDvuHxqZh

@CBSDenver: "Diana DeGette Urges FDA To Warn Doctors About Prescribing Hydroxychloroquine For Coronavirus" >> https://t.co/MNwbpw4BrH   Contradicting the recommendations of the FDA during a public health crisis is not a safe or productive path forward. https://t.co/PM7RDbhq6q

There's no doubt that each and every one of us has been impacted by the coronavirus. That's why I wanted to take a minute to check in and hear how you're doing.   If you're comfortable sharing please take this short COVID-19 impact survey today: https://t.co/vweq289bVj

I want you to know my priorities for the fourth piece of COVID-19 legislation:  ✅ Additional support for workers; ✅ Rent relief;  ✅ No-cost coronavirus treatment; and ✅ Congressional investigation into the federal government's failed response.  MORE >> https://t.co/Q1BgBXWEO9 https://t.co/NA715VlPNL

Today is #EqualPayDay a time to remember that women still earn only 81.6 cents for every dollar a man makes -- and that number is even lower for women of color.   The COVID-19 pandemic has only amplified and exacerbated these inequalities.   Learn more >> https://t.co/0zn3MeKTAh https://t.co/DU1cnF3CDv

While there is still much more to be done our third piece of COVID-19 legislation will bring much needed economic relief to American workers.  @CNBC: "Trump signs $2 trillion coronavirus relief bill as the US tries to prevent economic devastation" >> https://t.co/HgwePJm16R

ICYMI: Last Friday I introduced the No Cost for COVID-19 Testing Act to require all health insurance companies to cover the full cost of all coronavirus testing.  READ MORE: https://t.co/BebcDXU7eY https://t.co/auUYEPR0rn

Coronavirus relief loans are available for small Colorado businesses. Here’s how to apply >> https://t.co/w6wHa1wPyl   Small businesses employ over 1.1 million Coloradans.   It's critical we stand with them now and ensure they are supported through this crisis. https://t.co/6vwUc2vqki

As chair of the committee that oversees the CDC and National Institute of Health I joined KOA News Radio to discuss the coronavirus being labeled a global emergency and what steps are being taken to ensure the safety of those in the U.S.  CHECK IT OUT: https://t.co/2VkbBpJND1 https://t.co/LEQGxTXhED

Coronavirus is dangerous but remains largely contained to mainland China. In the meantime it's critical we make sure we're prepared to quickly develop and distribute a vaccine to the American public in the unlikely event of an outbreak here.  Read more >> https://t.co/Cr2xtuspf1

FYI I’ll be meeting this week with the Centers for Disease Control and National Institutes of Health about the coronavirus and what we’re doing from the public health perspective to stop it.  MORE >> https://t.co/Y2VNowLQgP
